IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Pillar College is an independent, faith-based 4 year institution of higher education.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Pillar College is an independent, faith-based, 4 year institution of higher education licensed by the state of New Jersey and accredited by Middle States Commission on Higher Education and the Association of Biblical Higher Education.
IRS990.Desc: Pillar College is the only accredited, private Christian College in New Jersey. Pillar College was founded in 1908 and established and chartered by the New Jersey Commission on Higher Education in 2001. We are located in Newark, Somerset and Paterson New Jersey, serving approximately 650 undergraduate and graduate students. The college offers Master of Arts in Counseling and Ministry Leadership, Bachelor of Arts in Biblical Studies, Business Administration & Management, Elementary Education, Intercultural Communication and Psychology and Counseling.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule A, Part II, Line 10, Explanation of Other Income:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Other income - 2016 Amount: $ 120,074. 2017 Amount: $ 52,341. 2018 Amount: $ 180,106. 2019 Amount: $ 36,885. 2020 Amount: $ 57,072. Insurance proceeds - 2018 Amount: $ 18,845. 2019 Amount: $ 170,000. 2020 Amount: $ 2,581. Reimbursements - 2020 Amount: $ 62,543.

The organization is a school as described under 170(b)(1)(A)(ii) and is not required to complete a public support schedule. Schedule A, Part II is completed to verify the School can qualify under public charity status section 170(b)(1)(A)(vi) and, therefore, qualifies to use the first listed special rule for Schedule B reporting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization publicized its racially nondiscriminatory policy on the homepage of its website at all times during its tax year in a manner reasonably expected to be noticed by visitors.

Pillar College receives funding through Pell, NJ TAG and Federal Direct Loans. The college also received funds through the Payroll Protection Program and Higher Education Emergency Relief (HEERF) as part of the CARES Act.

Pillar College awards Title IV funds to students for the purpose of assisting with tuition and related college expenses. Students must meet eligibility requirements before funds are awarded. Awards are applied directly to student accounts.

Pursuant to Internal Revenue Code Section 107, ministerial housing allowances are provided for qualifying ministerial employees. This is not included in taxable compensation. Dr. David Schoeder, Ex-Officio/President met the qualifications for and received a ministerial housing allowance during the tax year.
The board approved nonfixed payments made in the form discretionay bonuses.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: Family member of David Schroeder, President
Family member of David Schroeder, President
Family member of David Schroeder, President

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee consists of at least one-third (1/3) of the board members of Pillar College, including the Chairman and Vice Chairman. The Executive Committee shall be empowered to act on behalf of the board between meetings of the board with the exception of appointing/removing trustees or officers, making changes to the bylaws or articles of incorporation, or any action that requires seventy-five percent (75%) board approval. All actions taken by the Executive Committee shall be reported to the board within thirty (30) days of such action.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Phil Casciano and Frank Donaruma have a family relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is prepared by an independent CPA firm and reviewed in detail by the organization's top management. The reviewed Form 990 is then provided to the board of directors prior to filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization requires all officers and board members to annually complete and sign a conflict of interest questionnaire. The Board Chairman is responsible for reviewing the signed statements and ensuring that interested persons are in compliance with the conflict of interest policy. The Board Secretary reviews the Board Chairman's statement. Should any potential conflicts of interest be disclosed, the board member or officer would be asked to refrain from participation in any deliberation or decision with regard to matters affected by the relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation for the Ex-Officio/President and Chief Operating Officer is reviewed by the Administrative Committee of the Board. Compensation for other officers is determined and reviewed by the Administrative Committee of the Board. Comparability data is used and the approval process is documented in the HR files.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available upon request.
